name: Michael Broussard
title: Senior Frontend Engineer
objective: To continue growing as a Frontend Developer by leveraging my expertise in modern web technologies and user-centric design principles to build scalable, efficient, and engaging applications.

responsibilities: Mastered Angular, Angular Material, Kendo UI, RxJS, Jasmine, and TypeScript on the job, applying best practices to develop scalable, performant front-end solutions.
Defined and maintained an organized file structure, implementing Angular architecture patterns with an emphasis on smart and dumb components for optimized reusability and clarity.
Developed robust services for API integration, implementing HTTP interceptors, error logging, and HTTP method handling to ensure efficient and secure communication with back-end services.
Managed Angular framework upgrades from version 11 to 18, ensuring compatibility and stability with each release cycle by maintaining all dependencies and third-party libraries.
Authored comprehensive unit tests in Jasmine, achieving high code coverage and ensuring the reliability and maintainability of the frontend.
Mentored junior developers in S.O.L.I.D principles, Angular best practices, TypeScript, RxJS, SCSS, and design patterns, fostering a culture of clean code and best practices.
Performed peer code reviews and collaborated through paired programming, driving continuous improvement and innovative solutions across the team.

Refactored the entire front-end architecture from a large-module, three-part structure to standalone components in Angular 18, halving the bundle size and increasing modularity by separating app-wide functionality from feature-specific code.
Collaborated closely with the backend team and contributed to C# business logic and SQL query optimizations to ensure seamless integration of front and back-end processes.
solutions: Designed a streamlined solution for handling SignalR request responses using a command pattern and a custom service, simplifying API integration and enabling developers to focus on core functionality.
Built a dynamic UI generation system that constructs controls based on JSON instructions from the server, empowering junior developers to create device management features directly from the database.
Developed a mock data interceptor to allow front-end development in a disconnected state, significantly boosting productivity by simulating API responses during back-end development.
Created reusable, extendable data-editing components with unique expand-from-screen-edge animations, facilitating mobile-responsive designs and enhancing user experience across layouts.
Implemented a client-side authentication and role-based access control system using server-generated access tokens, including background token refresh for uninterrupted user sessions.

responsibilities: Developed the front end for a mobile single-page application (SPA) using Knockout.js, jQuery, JavaScript, and CSS, delivering a responsive, user-friendly interface.
Implemented back-end features in Node.js to manipulate and serve data from a NoSQL database, supporting real-time data requirements for mobile use cases.
Engineered the front end for an IoT-based remote monitoring application using JavaScript and Bootstrap, enabling users to track and manage oil and gas assets remotely.
Built and maintained C# and ASP.NET back-end services, utilizing Entity Framework with LINQ and SQL databases to efficiently query, update, and manipulate data for the front end.
Optimized SQL queries, cursors, and stored procedures in SQL Management Studio, improving data retrieval performance and application responsiveness.
Ensured comprehensive testing coverage by implementing client-side tests in Mocha and server-side tests in NUnit, improving the reliability and maintainability of the application.

Authored modules and detailed documentation on coding best practices, testing strategies, client-side development standards, and complex technical concepts to support team onboarding and knowledge sharing.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
